caption.title: Forecasting rubella epidemic in 2012 and 2013, Japan.
caption.p: The antilogarithmic scaling of vertical axis of Fig 4 in the main text. Forecasts with 95% prediction intervals for six prefectures are shown. Six prefectures with different population sizes were selected. Bars measure the weekly number of reported cases. For the 2012 forecasting, we repeated the filtering process up to 112th day (when an exponential growth in the first year begins) and repeated the prediction process up to the end of the epidemic. Mean and 95% credible intervals (CrIs) in filtering process are displayed by solid curves and gray shaded areas, respectively. For the 2013 forecasting, the filtering process was continued up to 308th day on which an exponential growth in the second year began.
Click here for additional data file.
